articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded the Gaza Strip's historic refugee camps in the centre of the enclave and struck Gaza City in the north on Thursday, killing at least 13 people, and tanks pushed deeper into Rafah in the south, health officials and residents said.
articles.title: Israel bombards central Gaza as tanks advance deeper in Rafah

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: When intelligence officials briefed Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in May ahead of a snap presidential election, their report was grim: angered by economic hardship and crackdowns on social freedoms, most Iranians planned to boycott the vote and turnout would only be about 13%.
articles.title: How Iran's Khamenei elevated a little-known moderate to the presidency

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Student protesters demanding an end to quotas for government jobs in Bangladesh called on Thursday for a complete shutdown nationwide, after deadly clashes this week killed six and injured hundreds.
articles.title: Bangladesh quota protesters call for nationwide shutdown amid clashes

articles.author: Laurie Chen, Jessie Pang
articles.description: China's Communist Party removed its former foreign and defence ministers, Qin Gang and Li Shangfu, from its Central Committee on Thursday during a meeting of its largest top decision-making body, state news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China's Communist Party removes ex-foreign, defence ministers from top body

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Police in northern India have asked owners of restaurants to list the names of their workers on display boards during a Hindu holy month that begins next week, sparking fears it is an attempt to identify Muslims and create a "communal divide".
articles.title: North India eateries told to display employee names in Hindu holy month, sparking anger

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Marta Fiorin
articles.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen vowed on Thursday to create a "European Defence Union" and to stay the course on Europe's green transition while cushioning its burden on industry as she pitched for a second term.
articles.title: EU's von der Leyen vows defence push, climate continuity in bid for second term

articles.author: Nathan Layne, James Oliphant, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Donald Trump's vice presidential running mate, U.S. Senator J.D. Vance, addresses the Republican National Convention on Wednesday in a speech that could illustrate how Trump's "Make America Great Again" movement may dominate the party for years to come.
articles.title: Rising Republican star J.D. Vance to take spotlight ahead of Trump, as Biden contracts COVID

articles.author: Alien Fernandez
articles.description: Havana is famed for the colorful vintage cars that can still be seen puttering around its streets and are a popular subject for visitors' photographs.
articles.title: Havana's roads change as Cubans adopt electric bikes and vehicles

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine hopes a rollout of AI-enabled drones across the front line will help it overcome increasing signal jamming by the Russians as well as enable unmanned aerial vehicles to work in larger groups.
articles.title: Ukraine rushes to create AI-enabled war drones

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's supreme court on Thursday upheld a landmark ruling that same-sex partners were eligible to spousal benefits from state insurer.
articles.title: South Korea's top court upholds landmark ruling over same-sex spousal state benefits
